Posts.Content: Mikesgirl17 wrote: Hi. I am 40 years old. At 34 I was diagnosed with D.C.I.S. Opted for double mastectomy with immediate reconstruction. I just found a lump. Had it biopsied and it is cancer again. 5mm triple negative. I need radiation, but in order to do it they have to remove both my implants because one would be in the way. Now I am faced with having the horrible expanders put in after the surgeon removes the tumor. The one that would be in the way of the radiation will not be filled until after radiation. The other would be fully filled before radiation starts. I don't know what to do. My fear is that the radiation will make my skin unable to heal properly. I also can't stand the fact that I will have the expanders in for who knows how long. I already have low self esteem and can't imagine not having breast. If anyone has had expanders in and then radiation, could you please let me know what your outcome was. Thanks. Dx 10/6/2013, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 2, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 11/7/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Chemotherapy 12/4/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: recurrance after reconstruction need radiation Mikesgirl17 BayouBabe

Posts.Content: May 16, 2014 01:34PM Mikesgirl17 wrote: Question....Furry face.  seriously really bad.  Is this temporary or permanant?  It's been 8 weeks since my last chemo.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 21, 2014 09:57AM - edited May 21, 2014 09:58AM by Mikesgirl17 Eye brows....my last chemo was March 17.  About a week later all my eyebrows fell out along with most of my lashes.  I felt like a freak without brows, more so than being bald.  On April 23 my eyebrow area looked blue, sort of like 5 o clock shadow.  I am happy to say that today, May 21, my lashes have started growing in nicely and my eyebrows are mostly all back  I will mention that I used Model Supplies rapid brow growth that I bought on Amazon and think it helped a lot.  I don't know for sure, but I have more brows on the outside edges than I had before.  I also couldn't take the peach fuzz all over my face so I used the finishing touch trimmer. $10 at dept. stores.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 16, 2014 06:01PM Mikesgirl17 wrote: Geosomin, That is how mine started coming  in.  Now it is all over and filling in nicely.  My last chemo was march 17.

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2014 06:23PM Mikesgirl17 wrote: Lorbgoo, I rubbed a mixture of coconut oil and caster oil on.  Let it sit for as long as you can stand.  It smells great too.  I found the instructions on youtube.  I don't know if it helped, but at least I felt better knowing I was doing something.  Good luck!

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2014 06:12AM Mikesgirl17 wrote:  Hi ladies. It's been a while since I posted, but wanted to share some pics with you so you know what to possibly expect a year after your first chemo. It was one year for me on Dec. 5. I had my hair trimmed a couple months ago and went for an actual hair cut last week. Mine did not come in grey. This is my natural color. It did start out white so I assumed it was going to be grey, but it changed after about 1/4 inch. I didn't shave it off like some people do. I too had face fur. It was horrible. it was like pretty long and all over. I used the finishing touch trimmer on it and was so happy I did. It eventually slows down and isn't noticeable. I hope these pics don't come out to big. I don't know how to change the size. Happy Saturday everyone!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2014 09:07AM Mikesgirl17 wrote: My hair is actually still thin. (Always was!) I have to use mousse and spray gel to get it to look like this. One day I let it air dry and it was awful. Limp, lifeless and flat to my head. I try not to complain because hair is hair. It keeps us warm. I was so cold last year. The Maine winter was brutal!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2014 10:00AM Mikesgirl17 wrote: Hi ladies.  I don't post very often, but I had a question.  My last chemo was March 17.  My eyebrows started coming back about 2 months later.  I was pleasantly surprised that they were coming in nice and full.  I hadn't really been paying too much attention to them, until yesterday.  When I took off my sun glasses and looked in the rear view mirror I noticed that they were not the same shape.  At closer inspection, it appears that they are thinning AGAIN!  Really?????? Now I read that they can thin and fall out over and over again.  This is heart breaking.  I am already so self conscious about how I look.  Now another hit to my ego.  Has this happened to anyone else.  I put Model Supplies rapid brow growth on as soon as I got home.  It seemed to help when I first started growing them so maybe it will help them fill in again.  UGGGGHHHH!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2014 09:14PM Mikesgirl17 wrote: Lisa, you do look like Annie.  My husband and I were buying a car this week-end, and the salesman said "Has anyone ever told you you look like a certain actress?"  I said no.  He then said you look like Jamie Lee Curtis.  I giggled and said, "It must be the hair."  My husband kind of chuckled.  He said, "No, it's the eyes and everything."  Then I said, "The True Lies era right?" ;)  Yeah he said,.  Then he pulled up a picture of her.  I don't think we look anything alike.

Posts.Content: May 17, 2014 10:20AM Mikesgirl17 wrote: Homemom, I too highly recommend icing hands and feet during infusions.  I used soft ice packs that I madr myself and fleece pouches to put them in.  I only got neuropathy slih=ghtly in 1 thumb and had no nail issues.  It is the most important thing you can do for yourself in my opinion.  Soft ice pack is 1 cup rubbing alcohlol 2 cups water.  In gallon freezer bag .  (Double bagged in case of leaks.)
